page.title: 05Wardens at the Country Park
page.content: There are four full time wardens at Durlston Country Park, providing a valuable service to all visitors. This description gives some idea of the life of one of the wardens in 1985: "In the morning dad picks up the litter which badgers scatter from bins around.After that he counts up all the money from the ticket machines from the day before and banks it. At 10.30 a.m. he opens the Centre. He sometimes takes guided walks to show the people the rocks plants and trees of the Park. When he comes back he takes over at the information counter. Later he goes out mending barbed wire fences, or dry stone walls."
